subject: JUnit alternatives for C code
msgSnippet: I ve been using JUnit for a while now and quite like it. Unfortunately we ll be using C instead of Java in our next project. I ve been looking at cUnit, but it
messageBody:
I've been using JUnit for a while now and quite like it. Unfortunately
we'll be using C instead of Java in our next project. I've been
looking at cUnit, but it seems that it needs glib which we don't have
on our (embedded) platform. Anyone who knows other alternatives?

I also wonder about the effectiveness of a 'cUnit'-like framework if
it can't catch runtime errors (address errors, div by 0, ...) like
JUnit can.

Cheers,
-Ives
______________________________________________________________________
Ives Aerts (senior R&D engineer) Sony Visual Products Europe
